title: skills for next generation logistics and supply chain management
abstractText:
Focus of the Fellowship lies in the need for integrating the expertise Hull University Business School has in education to identify the skills needed for the next generation logistics and supply chain management professionals and develop the programmes to fulfil this need for sustainable employment in the industry.

The questions that this Fellowship will focus on are:

  • What are the skill levels and skill sets needed in logistics and SCM in UK today and ten years into the future?
  • What is the skill gap that currently exists, and how can that gap be eliminated?
  • How should the UK build an agreed strategy between employers and government on jobs to ensure reciprocity and fairness, and who should provide the training in order to eliminate the skills gap?
  • How does this issue vary with the size of business and across this industrial sector?

 

 

 

 

To facilitate access to data for this Fellowship, the LI has very good links with companies to draw upon. Many of the companies have mentioned this skills gap and the lack of enough qualified talent on all levels; thus the industry impact from the results of this Fellowship's work will be immediate and substantial.
